intro: Carolus anderssonii, commonly known as the Andersson's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
